topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53cdf60e6368725589250000#post_53cdf60e6368725589250000
Yes... yes really.

What has our generation done? Everything great about our lives is because of our grandfather's generation

Not. To say potential is not there, but I doubt we will be tested as he WW2 generation was: being born into an affluent era only to see it crashing down
topics.author: 4fe16df67f123b13e400003f

topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53cdf5f06368725238210000#post_53cdf5f06368725238210000
[bq="Whatevs"]"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53cdf4b863687213a0d80100#post_53cdf4b863687213a0d80100
they did more than we ever will.[/bq]
Biomechatronics, the widespread adoption of the internet, introduction of genetic vaccines for the first time to prevent genetic diseases, how we're a couple years off from HIV vaccines, water on mars, discovery of galaxies, discovery of potential parallel universes, discovery of higgs. . . five minutes later. . . neurochip technology being developed, algae biofuel in development, solar roadways, potential geoengineering, quantum computing being used for super computing, virtual lifeforms, synthetic food in development, 3D printing, self driving cars are in development, blue brain project, etc.

Even so: because of the wealth left by grandfathers. They made discoveries of their own at probably a higher level for the state of the times and rebuilt a country from the depression while also fighting in WW2.

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53cdf8426368725589910000#post_53cdf8426368725589910000
Not really. If one subtracts the increased war time production the issues of the depression continued into the 50s where we got out of it because we dominated the world economy.

FDR's New Deal prolonged the depression by a lot, but we was not of that generation, more like the prior generation.
Point: grandfathers lived through genuine scarcity without losing their dignity.
topics.author: 4fe16df67f123b13e400003f

[/bq]
What?  Just cause someone was born post 2000 you think they're automatically stupid and can't become scientists or doctors?
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53cdf80d636872540e740000#post_53cdf80d636872540e740000
[bq="Whatevs"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53cdf72f6368725387550000#post_53cdf72f6368725387550000
Even so: because of the wealth left by grandfathers. They made discoveries of their own at probably a higher level for the state of the times and rebuilt a country from the depression while also fighting in WW2.

[/bq]
The discovery of the higgs is the biggest scientific discovery in the last fifty years.  It's on par with the discovery of relativity, gravity and so forth.

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53cdf8cd63687253a7780000#post_53cdf8cd63687253a7780000
No I think if they were born 2000 they probably aren't old enough to be responsible for those things.


"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53cdf8cd63687253a7780000#post_53cdf8cd63687253a7780000
not discovered by Millenials iirc. Older scientists of prior generations

I also seem to recall pointing out that discoveries should be measured versus the state of the art. We are at a higher level so naturally our discoveries will be greater taken out of context.

topics.body: People who went through hardships of war tend to be more sensible, wise, and not take life for granted.

topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53cdfc366368725238580100#post_53cdfc366368725238580100
The reason why I'm not responding is you are:
!http://i2.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/original/000/720/231/baa.jpg!

You keep claiming to that you're right about everything and whenever someone brings you evidence to the contrary to you constantly quote rationalwiki to the point that you I rarely ever see you use something that isn't a copypasta or "creatively edited" from a source material.

The reason why I'm not responding is that you just respond by quoting wikis constantly and every time I do try to debate with you just go "Well -wikipedia says- you're wrong cause I say you're wrong so I'll go up and down five pages about how I am victorious while ignoring anyone that brings me proof to the contrary and demand that any evidence to the contrary must sustain my arbitrary requirements or be invalid to the point that even if it was by leading experts in the field it must be invalid therefore only things I every say that are valid are valid".

I doubt you could function without wikipedia or rationalwiki on your bookmarks and I'd be willing to bet good money you have during school debates before gotten your information off wikipedia or rationalwiki.

The reason why I'm not legitimately responding to you is that you're just another teen who thinks they know everything.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
>You keep claiming to that you’re right about everything and whenever someone brings you evidence to the contrary to you constantly quote rationalwiki to the point that you I rarely ever see you use something that isn’t a copypasta or "creatively edited" from a source material.

Untrue. You assume this and then I have to point out the article is sourced and then you kind of stop talking

>The reason why I’m not responding is that you just respond by quoting wikis constantly and every time I do try to debate with you just go "Well wikipedia says you’re wrong cause I say you’re wrong so I’ll go up and down five pages about how I am victorious while ignoring anyone that brings me proof to the contrary and demand that any evidence to the contrary must sustain my arbitrary requirements or be invalid to the point that even if it was by leading experts in the field it must be invalid therefore only things I every say that are valid are valid".


I have never quoted wikis. What a bizarre thing to say. The worst I have done is maybe posted a guy who at some point sourced wikipedia but that has never been brought to my attention. But it is a possibility.

Usually I am the one who presents evidence (remember that Indian Smallpox thing? I provided 3 sources that all referenced academic papers and historical records)

You're just a liar who can't handle the fact that I don't swallow what you shit out.
Now, yes or no: were those discoveries made by Millenials?
Because if you can't answer this, then I call distraction and intellectual dishonesty on your part.
